messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] surfing was skateboarding
messages.messageBody:
HMSL2@... wrote:
<<<Bic is yes the pen company but they make an indestructible surf boards. They
are made of something very close to the pen material and they dont break!>>>

Cool, thanx I'll look into it.

<<<The swimming part I dont think is that big of a deal, when they start they
are in knee deep water, the wet suits float a bit and there is usually
someone with them when they begin.>>>

Thanx, I'll mention this to my friend and see if he's okay with that.

<<<We are in Maine by the NH line.
Are you close?>>>

I wish, we're in San Diego.

<<<Dustin suggested earlier when he was reading my response that
we should have an Unschoolers meet at the beach and he would show anyone who
wanted to surf how to begin. Its not hard to begin its just trusting yourself
and getting a little wet. Well, cold too the water here never warms up
enough.>>>

It would be great if we could, but it's kinda far on the bus <g>. I don't know if anyone in our local group surfs or not, I havent seen it mentioned, but I'll have to ask.

Rebecca


*~*Leave the crowd, look within, and let your dreams soar*~*

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] skateboarding was How much interaction time with chi...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/13/2003 11:23:11 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Bic is yes the pen company but they make an indestructible surf boards. They are made of
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/13/2003 11:23:11 PM Eastern Standard Time,
elfmama@... writes:

>
> Where do you live? Jaiden really wants to start surfing this summer, Jason
> and I don't surf, don't know how. Our friend is willing to teach him, but
> he wants Jaiden to be a really good swimmer before he gets on a board.
> (Makes sense to me, but Jaiden is a little upset about it.)
>
> "In Gods Hands" is a surfing movie(a real movie not a documentary) about
> big water surfing in Hawaii. It's good, they had real big water surfers
> surfing real big water. It was amazing, getting pulled in by jet skis just
> so you could drop in on a wave, and the waves! I didn't know they could get
> so big.
>
> And Larid (I think I spelled that right) is a doc about Laird and his
> surfing experiences. They show him surfing Tava Ruah(sp?) beautiful.
>
> I'm gonna show my ignorance...whats a Bic?
>
> Rebecca

Bic is yes the pen company but they make an indestructible surf boards. They
are made of something very close to the pen material and they dont break!

That movie sounds cool.

The swimming part I dont think is that big of a deal, when they start they
are in knee deep water, the wet suits float a bit and there is usually
someone with them when they begin.

We are in Maine by the NH line.
Are you close? Dustin suggested earlier when he was reading my response that
we should have an Unschoolers meet at the beach and he would show anyone who
wanted to surf how to begin. Its not hard to begin its just trusting yourself
and getting a little wet. Well, cold too the water here never warms up
enough.

Laura D


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] skateboarding was How much interaction time with chi...
messages.messageBody:
HMSL2@... wrote:

<<<My son owns both of them.
I traded my board for one for him he loves surfing, lives for it during the
summer.
What is "in Gods Hands"?
Your son would do well on a Bic.>>>

Where do you live? Jaiden really wants to start surfing this summer, Jason and I don't surf, don't know how. Our friend is willing to teach him, but he wants Jaiden to be a really good swimmer before he gets on a board. (Makes sense to me, but Jaiden is a little upset about it.)

"In Gods Hands" is a surfing movie(a real movie not a documentary) about big water surfing in Hawaii. It's good, they had real big water surfers surfing real big water. It was amazing, getting pulled in by jet skis just so you could drop in on a wave, and the waves! I didn't know they could get so big.

And Larid (I think I spelled that right) is a doc about Laird and his surfing experiences. They show him surfing Tava Ruah(sp?) beautiful.

I'm gonna show my ignorance...whats a Bic?

Rebecca








*~*Leave the crowd, look within, and let your dreams soar*~*

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] skateboarding was How much interaction time with chi...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/13/2003 10:20:03 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... My son owns both of them. I traded my board for one for him he loves surfing, lives for it
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/13/2003 10:20:03 PM Eastern Standard Time,
elfmama@... writes:

> HMSL2@... wrote:
> <<<Have they seen Endless Summer and Endless Summer II? How old is Jaiden?>>
> >
>
> We have seen both, although not for a long time. We'll have to get them
> again. Jaiden is almost 5. We have In Gods Hands and we just say Laird, it
> was amazing. Have you seen them?
>
> Rebecca

My son owns both of them.
I traded my board for one for him he loves surfing, lives for it during the
summer.
What is "in Gods Hands"?
Your son would do well on a Bic.

Laura D

messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/12/2003 7:06:15 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Hello, Have they seen Endless Summer and Endless Summer II? How old is Jaiden? Laura D
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/12/2003 7:06:15 PM Eastern Standard Time,
elfmama@... writes:

> Have you guys seen 'Dogtown and Z-boys'? it's this really amazing
> documentary about the birth of skateboarding as we know it today. We
> watched it yesterday, it was really good. jaiden is getting interested in
> skateboarding and surfing, we watch a lot of skateboarding and surfing
> movies and almost all of our friend do one if not both and are all waiting
> for him to get just a little older so they can start taking him out.
>
> Rebecca

Hello,

Have they seen Endless Summer and Endless Summer II? How old is Jaiden?


Laura D

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/12/2003 7:05:57 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
elfmama@... writes:


> Have you guys seen 'Dogtown and Z-boys'? it's this really amazing
> documentary about the birth of skateboarding as we know it today. We
> watched it yesterday, it was really good. jaiden is getting interested in
> skateboarding and surfing, we watch a lot of skateboarding and surfing
> movies and almost all of our friend do one if not both and are all waiting
> for him to get just a little older so they can start taking him out.
>

Ben and Cameron went to see it. Ben was RAVING! He was amazed at what these
kids went through and what they accomplished. They had a great time!

~Kelly
